SENT.plain: A patient with Barrett's esophagus and high grade dysplasia is presented
He underwent a fundoplication and, subsequently, nearly three years of high-dose proton pump inhibition therapy
At the time of esophagogastrectomy, extensive squamous re-epithelialization was observed along with two histologic foci of intramucosal adenocarcinoma
Despite partial regression of Barrett's esophagus, high grade dysplasia present for more than 4 years had progressed to adenocarcinoma
Partial squamous repopulation of Barrett's esophagus is an inadequate endpoint of therapy
Complete regression is necessary to eliminate the risk of cancer
